candidates.title: Small improvements.
candidates.body:
Notable changes:
- remove a clone when instantiating a Redis memory;
- strengthen the concurrency test by looping `N` times in each concurrent worker
- remove a redundant condition in the g-write script
- remove some unnecessary bounds in the generic tests
- remove redundant documentation (please, refrain your LLM)
- remove the `bench` feature

candidates.title: Feat/findex server v7
candidates.body: # PR Overview - generic memory tests - redis store - a new feature : storing the LUA script in the db cache **(this optimization was not reviewed in the previous branch)** - exporting necessary primitives for findex-server (dummy encode & co ) # Info to know This branch is the version of findex that findex server will depend on Direct dependency of this PR : https://github.com/Cosmian/findex-server/pull/20 Almost all the code in this PR was already discussed and reviewed, for reference : - https://github.com/Cosmian/findex/pull/98 -and https://github.com/Cosmian/findex/pull/93 ### PR health check ups - [x] Add modifications of the other PR and close it - [x] Everything compiles - [x] Benches testes to work correctly after the update (too long to run locally but seems to be OK ) - [x] **Added redis DB to the CI** - [x] Tested this new branch on findex-server and nothing has 'changed'

candidates.title: Fix/review
candidates.body: Correct some clippy lints, explicit ADT = Abstract Data Type and add `Cargo.toml` information from prepare_findex_server_v7

candidates.title: E-print submission.
candidates.body: Implement the e-print version of Findex.

candidates.title: Review
candidates.body:
Remove useless pragmas, dep. features and clones in `redis_mem.rs`.
+ rename to remove the mention to "store" everywhere.

candidates.title: feat: add logs on Index traits
candidates.body:
in order to instrument logs (through `tracing` crate):
- add macro structures over `EdxStore` trait
- implement on those structures the `Display` trait
- work on this https://github.com/Cosmian/cloudproof_rust/pull/52 to integrate new logs

candidates.title: Fix/relax async req
candidates.body:
Using `#[async_trait]` enforce trait member outputs to implement `Send`, which is not possible when working with WASM in CloudproofRust.

Using `#[async_trait(?Send)]` allows relaxing this constraint.

candidates.title: Run stable Rust
candidates.body:
- use `never` crate instead of `!` nightly feature
- use `async-trait` crate instead of `async fn in trait` nightly feature
- remove toolchain file for nightly compilation

candidates.title: feat: add non-regression test
candidates.body:
- add compiler feature to examples, tests and benchmarks
- add non-regression tests
- clean the `datasets` repository and add files used by the non-regression test

candidates.body:
fix: make compact callbacks async
    
    - `update_lines`
    - `list_removed_locations`
    - `filter_removed_locations`
    
    Fix doc mistake for `list_removed_locations` (negation was missing)

candidates.title: Fix/alloc problem with multi values in fetch entry tables
candidates.body:
## [2.0.4] - 2023-05-23

### Bug Fixes

- Add entry table number in FFI functions in order to pre-allocate the output buffer size in fetching callbacks

candidates.title: Feature/refactoring
fix: simplify the Findex search algorithm
candidates.body:
- remove the recursion
- remove unnecessary filter on the graph insertions
- remove the `max_depth` parameter: avoiding looping on automate cycles is enough to ensure the algorithm will return; an early return can still be asked by the user via the `progress()` callback
- use iterators where possible

This implementations uses one more clone of the input keywords. However, since a useless clone from the previous implementation has been removed, there should be the same nomber of clones in both versions.

candidates.title: feat: batch keywords together when calling fetch chains callbacks
candidates.body:
## [2.0.2] - 2023-04-21

**This version follows the 2.0.0 since the 2.0.1 version introduced breaking changes we didn't want to include.**

### Changed

- Batch keywords together when calling the fetch chains callback (prevent doing one fetch chains request by keyword)

candidates.title: Improve callbacks
candidates.body:
- remove `HashSet` in callbacks parameters where it is possible. This
  avoids hashing data where it is not necessary;
- remove references in callback parameters where it is possible. This
  may avoid cloning in the callback implementation.

The performances are greatly improved:

```
search/Searching 1 word time:   [8.6417 ms 8.6586 ms 8.6760 ms]
                        change: [+1.0528% +1.4871% +1.9134%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)

search/Searching 10 words
                        time:   [7.5445 ms 7.5692 ms 7.5944 ms]
                        change: [-7.6182% -7.0244% -6.4150%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)

search/Searching 100 words
                        time:   [7.5683 ms 7.5908 ms 7.6142 ms]
                        change: [-40.753% -40.385% -40.010%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)

search/Searching 1000 words
                        time:   [16.768 ms 16.809 ms 16.852 ms]
                        change: [-28.441% -28.006% -27.590%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)

upsert/Indexing 20 keywords
                        time:   [199.43 µs 200.09 µs 200.79 µs]
                        change: [-15.166% -14.656% -14.161%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)

upsert/Indexing 200 keywords
                        time:   [1.9258 ms 1.9319 ms 1.9382 ms]
                        change: [-13.512% -13.005% -12.489%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

upsert/Indexing 2000 keywords
                        time:   [19.937 ms 19.986 ms 20.037 ms]
                        change: [-3.1133% -2.7406% -2.3728%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
```

Edit: the performances are actually deteriorated for the search
```
search/Searching 1 word time:   [7.6593 ms 7.6773 ms 7.6959 ms]
                        change: [+8.4167% +8.7806% +9.1575%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has regressed.

search/Searching 10 words
                        time:   [7.8339 ms 7.8553 ms 7.8771 ms]
                        change: [+9.3196% +9.7362% +10.148%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has regressed.

search/Searching 100 words
                        time:   [8.7041 ms 8.7246 ms 8.7457 ms]
                        change: [+7.2710% +7.6430% +8.0372%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has regressed.

search/Searching 1000 words
                        time:   [18.049 ms 18.093 ms 18.138 ms]
                        change: [+1.9513% +2.3140% +2.6855%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has regressed.

upsert/Indexing 20 keywords
                        time:   [199.60 µs 200.32 µs 201.06 µs]
                        change: [-2.0574% -1.5254% -1.0051%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

upsert/Indexing 200 keywords
                        time:   [1.9194 ms 1.9258 ms 1.9325 ms]
                        change: [-1.4786% -1.0214% -0.5765%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Change within noise threshold.

upsert/Indexing 2000 keywords
                        time:   [20.059 ms 20.109 ms 20.162 ms]
                        change: [-3.2296% -2.8747% -2.5285%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

```

candidates.title: Feature/live compact
refactor!: remove interfaces (ffi, wasm, cloud, pyo3)
Feature/update progress callback
Improve perfs on noisy fetch chains
candidates.body:
Since fetchChains is often an IO intensive task, call the futures in parallel instead of calling them one by one can save a lot of time.

This implementation still call in sync for each keyword, we may put the outer loop inside the `join_all(futures)` too to call everything in parallel

We may have problems about the number of requests in parallel in the browser… Currently we send around 900 fetchChains requests in parallel (if it's HTTP, the browser could be not happy at all…)

candidates.title: Set serialization fix + suppress fetch entry loop
candidates.body:
### Bug Fixes

- FFI: fix serialization of returned values in `fetch_entry`
- compact: replace fetch_entry loop with call to `fetch_entry_table_uids`
